titleStmt.title: for "Again old heart so gay"
a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman
titleStmt.sponsor: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities, University of Nebraska-Lincoln
titleStmt.funder: The National Endowment for the Humanities

address.addrLine: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Any reuse of the material should credit the Walt Whitman Archive.

notesStmt.note: Written on government stationery with the head "Department of Justice, Washington D.C." and the date "Dec. 7, 1871"

verso of second leaf shows the lower part of a stationery heading, of which the top line has been cut away. The second line reads "Washington" followed by the numerals "187" which are presumably for the year part of the date, with the last numeral to be filled in later.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.orgName: The Thomas Biggs Harned Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1842–1937, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

div1.ab:
Piece for conclusion of of "Again old heart" &c in which (may be very brief & ejaculatory)—
the idea is that of real instead of death, it is birth
—instead of deceace , it is parturition,
—instead of being boundimprisoned in the grave, it is escape & extrication
instead of being "an eternal sleep" it is now only that I (:we) shall really awake
